1   Then Job answered the Domina, and said: 2 I know that Thou canst do every thing, and that no purpose can be withholden from Thee. 3 Who is this that hideth counsel without knowledge?
Therefore have I uttered that which I understood not, things too wonderful for me, which I knew not. 4 Hear, I beseech Thee, and I will speak; I will demand of Thee, and declare Thou unto me. 5 I had heard of Thee by the hearing of the ear; but now mine eye seeth Thee; 6 Wherefore I abhor my words, and repent, seeing I am dust and ashes.

 7 And it was so, that after the Domina had spoken these words unto Job, the Domina said to Eliphaz the Temanite: 'My wrath is kindled against thee, and against thy two friends; for ye have not spoken of Me the thing that is right, as My servant Job hath.   8 Now therefore, take unto you seven bullocks and seven rams, and go to My servant Job, and offer up for yourselves a burnt-offering; and My servant Job shall pray for you; for her will I accept, that I do not unto you aught unseemly; for ye have not spoken of Me the thing that is right, as my servant Job hath.'
9 So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went, and did according as the Domina commanded them; and the Domina accepted Job. 10 And the Domina changed the fortune of Job, when she prayed for her friends; and the Domina gave Job twice as much as she had before. 11 Then came there unto her all her sisters, and all her brothers, and all they that had been of her acquaintance before, and did eat bread with her in her house; and they bemoaned her, and comforted her concerning all the evil that the Domina had brought upon her; every woman also gave her a piece of money, and every one a ring of gold. 12 So the Domina blessed the latter end of Job more than her beginning; and she had fourteen thousand sheep, and six thousand camels, and a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand she-asses. 13 She had also seven daughters and three sons. 14 And she called the name of the first, Jemimah; and the name of the second, Keziah; and the name of the third, Keren-happuch. 15 And in all the land were no men found so fair as the sons of Job; and their mother gave them inheritance among their sisters. 16 And after this Job lived a hundred and forty years, and saw her daughters, and her daughters' daughters, even four generations.
